basics.name: Winston Wei-Han Chou
basics.label: Undergraduate Student
basics.summary: Aspiring applied scientist and roboticist with a strong foundation in engineering, physics, and management. Currently pursuing a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering (Controls & Robotics) at UC San Diego. Passionate about advancing robotics, artificial intelligence, and STEM education through research and outreach.

work.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.
highlights: Relativity

education.area: BS in Mechanical & Aerospace Engineering, Specialized in Controls & Robotics | GPA: 3.99/4.0
courses: Robotics: Sensing and Estimation in Robotics (Graduate), Machine Learning for Robotics (Graduate, audited), Robotics (Graduate), Introduction to Autonomous Vehicles
AI/ML: Machine Learning for Robotics (Graduate, audited), Probability and Statistical Methods for Engineering, Computational Methods in Engineering
Mechanical: Design of Machine Elements, Computational Methods for Design, Solid Mechanics I, Mechanical Behavior of Materials

skills.name: Software & Embedded
keywords: Python, C++, C, LabVIEW, MATLAB, Java, HTML
ROS, ROS2 (Robot Operating System), Git, Docker, Keras, Tensorflow

experience.organization: Existential Robotics Laboratory, UC San Diego
highlights: Contributing to a faculty-led research project advancing real-time aerial mapping and autonomous navigation using quadrotor UAVs.
Assisting with drone mechanical design and build process for new experiments, collaborating on simulation test setups.

experience.organization: UC San Diego, ECE & MAE Department
experience.position: Teaching Assistant, ECEMAE 148 Introduction to Autonomous Vehicles
experience.summary: Support student learning in robotics system integration, computer vision, navigation algorithms, computational strategies, machine learning systems, and vehicle dynamics.
highlights: Cover a wide range of topics, including robotics system integration, computer vision, navigation algorithms, computational strategies (on-vehicle vs. off-vehicle), machine learning systems like neural networks, and vehicle dynamics such as steering and locomotion.
Coach on programming assignments and project development.
Hold weekly office hours to support student learning.

experience.summary: Contributed to advancing the TAI-namics Software Stack with a primary focus on progressing from Model-in-Loop (MIL) testing toward Hardware-in-Loop (HIL) implementation.
highlights: Improved 98% software performance through optimizing spacecraft simulation MATLAB-C++ interface.
Developed Coefficient Proxy system for seamless data extraction and configuration management.
Migrated 5 critical spacecraft models to MATLAB with validation testing for TAI-namics software stack.
Researched and modeled 3D propellant sloshing dynamics using SE(3) screw theory and Lagrangian mechanics, achieving superior accuracy compared to linear models w.r.t. CFD validation.

experience.summary: Developed features for the Autonomous Mobile Robot (AMR) product line and improved odometry accuracy through sensor integration and control algorithm implementation.
highlights: Integrated AMR position and velocity data into ROS, enabling remote PID tuning.
Designed encoder accuracy experiments; quantified and corrected left/right wheel sensor errors (0.0039% / 0.00129%), reducing odometry drift to maintain a localization error below 0.49%.
Developed and tested a Ramsete Controller module to optimize odometry-based trajectory tracking.

experience.summary: Contributed to the development and integration of full-size Indy car racing control and simulation platforms for the Indy Autonomous Challenge (IAC), collaborating with university partners and researchers.
highlights: Participated in the IAC at CES 2025, contributing to the team’s 1st place finish in the passing tier competition.
Improved 3D adaptation of lap-time spline trajectory optimization and model predictive control (MPC) for gas-driven racing car models.
Led simulation interface development and manage workflows that integrate MATLAB/Simulink models from model-in-the-loop (MIL) to hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) environments.

experience.position: GoKart Software Team Lead / F1TENTH Racer Team Lead
experience.summary: Lead software development and autonomous racing for full-scale electric go-kart and F1TENTH teams, participating in international competitions.
highlights: Achieved 1st place in the National Grand Prix, 2025 Autonomous Karting Series (AKS) by leading the development and autonomous racing of a full-scale electric go-kart
Managed a multi-disciplinary team of 20+ engineers developing sensor fusion, trajectory planning, and motion control algorithms for high-speed autonomous racing.

volunteer.summary: Mentor for FIRST Robotics Competition team, guiding students in advanced control theory, robot design, and competition strategy.
highlights: Mentor a team of 40+ high school students in advanced robotics, leading the design, control, and fabrication workflows for multiple award-winning robots across consecutive FRC seasons

Deliver technical instruction spanning model-based control systems, Kalman-filter-based state estimation (sensor fusion with IMU and vision), structural design validation using FEA, mechanical failure prediction via Von Mises and Fatigue theories, factor-of-safety analyses, and hands-on feasibility testing for drivetrain and actuator components.
Develop and teach curriculum modules, fostering peer learning, leadership, and advanced engineering skills for student-driven competition success.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
highlights: Quantum Teleportation
Quantum Cryptography

awards.title: CKHSAASC Golden Brick Leadership Scholarship Award
awards.awarder: Chien Kuo High School Alumni Association of Southern California
awards.summary: Recognize the outstanding achievements of Chien Kuo High School Alumni Association of Southern California (CKHSAASC) student members or the descendants of CKHSAASC members as defined by CKHSAASC Bylaws.

awards.title: CCBA Southern California Outstanding Youth Achievement Award
awards.summary: The Chinese Consolidated Benevolent Association of Southern California's Outstanding Youth Achievement Awards and Model Youth Conference is an annual event hosted by the Chinese Consolidated Benevolent Association (CCBA) of Southern California. It aims to recognize the outstanding achievements of young Chinese Americans and encourage them to actively participate in society and demonstrate leadership. The awards cover a variety of areas, including academic performance, community service, arts and culture, athletics, and innovation, aiming to identify and recognize outstanding young people who have demonstrated outstanding professional and societal contributions.

awards.title: CKHSAASC Golden Brick Leadership Scholarship Award
awards.awarder: Chien Kuo High School Alumni Association of Southern California
awards.summary: Recognize the outstanding achievements of Chien Kuo High School Alumni Association of Southern California (CKHSAASC) student members or the descendants of CKHSAASC members as defined by CKHSAASC Bylaws.

awards.title: Distinguished Service Award
awards.awarder: Taipei Municipal Chien Kuo High School
awards.summary: Serve as Class leader for three consecutive years (10th, 11th, and 12th grades) and actively participate in various school activities, demonstrating leadership and commitment to the school community.

awards.title: Outstanding Performance Mayor Award
awards.summary: Category II Mayor Award (Outstanding Performance Mayor Award): Graduates who have outstanding performance during their studies, such as in sports, skills, arts, science or creativity, club activities, community or school service learning, respect for teachers and parents, acts of helping others, and other specific achievements.

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).
